about.name: I'm Nive!
about.tagline: Engineer, AI builder, MBA candidate, and Mom.
about.bio:
_Structural Engineer_ → _NYU Stern MBA (Business Analytics, Strategy, Technology Product Management)_
---
I started my career as a Structural Engineer, designing and managing water infrastructure systems that quietly keep entire cities running. What drew me to engineering back then is still true today: I love breaking down complexity, making sense of data, and building systems that work in the real world.
In 2023, I began my MBA at NYU Stern, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management. That's where my curiosity for AI really took off. I became fascinated by how engineering logic, product thinking, and data-driven decision-making come together to create smarter, more resilient organizations.
Since then, I've worked on projects ranging from AI-powered product design and climate-tech pricing models to construction-tech strategy and machine learning workflows. Across every space, one thing stays the same: I love turning ambiguity into structure, and structure into solutions people actually use.
Motherhood has added an unexpected and meaningful layer to my journey. Balancing a full-time career, graduate school, and raising a tiny human taught me resilience, empathy, and the power of small, consistent progress. It changed how I lead, how I build, and what I value in the work I choose to do.
Outside of work, you'll find me baking something sweet, hiking with my family, or inventing new toddler activities for my son. You'll also find me experimenting with AI tools and side projects — anything that blends curiosity with creativity and makes everyday life a little smarter or more joyful.
I also love connecting with people on similar paths. I regularly mentor students exploring engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or making early-career decisions. I enjoy helping early-stage startups think through ideas, and I support NGOs and mission-driven teams whenever I can. If you'd like to chat, brainstorm, or explore mentorship, feel free to reach out.
I’m excited for what comes next and grateful that our paths crossed here.
---
about.tldr:
### _**tl;dr**_
_I design water systems by day, build AI tools by night, and chase a toddler in between._
_If there's a messy business problem, I'll break it down._
_If there's data, I'll analyze it._
_And if there's a way AI can make life easier, I'm exploring how to build it._
---
# roles:
# - Product Management
# - Strategy & Operations
# - Applied AI
# interests:
# - AI tools and prototyping
# - Baking and hiking
# - Family and toddler activities

projects.title: Air France Search Advertising Optimization
projects.subtitle: Performance Analytics (Excel + STATA)
projects.overview: Analyzed Air France’s paid search advertising performance to identify which keywords, campaigns, and landing pages drive clicks, conversions, and revenue. Used CTR–TCR bubble charts and keyword tables to diagnose performance gaps and optimization opportunities.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Despite high click-through activity, 94% of searches resulted in zero bookings, revealing a major breakdown between ad engagement and conversion. Air France needed data-backed insights to improve landing page performance, keyword ROI, and budget allocation.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Raw Search Data → Excel Cleaning → CTR/TCR Modeling → Keyword ROI Analysis
→ Insights → Ad & Landing Page Optimization Strategy
challenges: High CTR but zero-conversion keywords
Large variance in CPC across brand vs generic keywords
Branded campaigns massively outperforming geo-targeted campaigns
Identifying the correct optimization levers (landing page vs keyword quality)
learned: How to combine CTR, TCR, CPC, and ROI to diagnose funnel performance
How branded keywords deliver higher intent and significantly better ROI
How visual modeling (bubble charts) reveals hidden performance clusters
How to translate marketing analytics into campaign strategy recommendations

projects.title: Billionaire Wealth & Economic Trends Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Global wealth analytics (Tableau + economic indicators)
projects.overview: Built an interactive Tableau dashboard analyzing billionaire demographics, wealth distribution, and economic indicators using a global dataset. The visual story highlights industry dominance, age and gender patterns, and economic relationships across GDP, CPI, tax rates, and billionaire concentration.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Policymakers and business analysts struggle to understand how billionaire wealth evolves across industries, countries, and economic conditions. The dataset is large and multi-dimensional, requiring clean visual storytelling to extract trends and support economic insight.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
A[Raw Kaggle Dataset] --> B[Data Cleaning in Tableau Prep]
B --> C[Tableau Dashboards]
C --> D[Industry & Country Visuals]
C --> E[Demographics]
C --> F[Economic Indicators]
F --> G[Insights & Trend Story]
stack: Exploratory charts: bar charts, scatter plots, maps, heatmaps
Economic correlation analysis (GDP, CPI, tax rates)
challenges: Combining demographic, industry, and economic variables into one narrative
Designing intuitive visual comparisons across countries and industries
Showing economic correlations without overfitting the visuals
Ensuring clarity while integrating multiple dashboards (country, demographics, macro trends)
learned: How to blend demographic and economic indicators in a unified visual story
How to apply visual hierarchy to guide users through complex insights
How to interpret GDP/CPI relationships using scatter and regression visuals
How emerging markets (India, China) shift global billionaire distribution

projects.title: Chocolate Sales Insights Report
projects.subtitle: Sales Analysis & Forecasting
projects.overview:
Analyzed a dataset of 5,000+ sales records to identify key revenue drivers and market trends.
**Findings**
- **Sales Forecasting**: The dataset covers a period showing a significant decline in sales volume (-86.11%). Immediate intervention is required.
- **Customer Behavior**: Top markets are Australia, UK, and India. Marketing efforts should be concentrated here.
- **Market Trends**: Tastes vary significantly by region (e.g., Australia prefers 50% Dark Bites, UK prefers Peanut Butter Cubes).
projects.problem:
**Business Problem**
The business faced a significant decline in sales volume (-86.11% from start to end of the recorded period). There was a critical need to investigate external market factors or internal operational issues and optimize inventory, pricing, and marketing strategies.
impact: Developed a data cleaning pipeline using Pandas to handle inconsistent currency formatting and date parsing, improving data quality by 100%.
Created interactive visualizations with Seaborn to showcase monthly sales trends and top-performing products, providing actionable insights for inventory management.
Automated the data acquisition and reporting process, reducing manual analysis time.

projects.title: Cinemex Demand & Pricing Strategy Analysis
projects.subtitle: Price elasticity & competitive response modeling (Economics)
projects.overview: Analyzed how 2-for-1 pricing introduced by a competitor impacted Cinemex’s attendance in Mexico City. Built counterfactuals, time-series graphs, demand curve diagrams, and multiple regressions to quantify lost demand and evaluate Cinemex’s eventual pricing response.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Cinemex experienced sudden drops in attendance after competitors launched aggressive Wednesday 2-for-1 pricing. The challenge was to isolate the true causal impact of competitor pricing and evaluate whether Cinemex should match the promotion.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
A[Attendance & Pricing Data 2000–2002] --> B[Time Series Analysis]
B --> C[Demand Curve Modeling]
C --> D[Counterfactual Construction]
D --> E[Multiple Regression Control Model]
E --> F[Elasticity Estimation]
F --> G[Pricing Recommendation]
stack: Multiple regression (controls for seasonality & city-wide demand)
challenges: Heavy seasonality in cinema attendance
Confounding factors (holidays, heat waves, new releases)
Limited 2.5 years of data available
High correlation between city-wide and Cinemex attendance
Lack of competitor pricing data beyond the 2-for-1 deal
learned: Competitor 2-for-1 pricing reduced Cinemex’s Wednesday attendance by ~22%
Cinemex’s own 2-for-1 introduction boosted winter attendance by ~27.5%
Cinemex demand on Wednesdays is highly elastic (ε ≈ 4–6)
Counterfactual modeling is crucial for isolating causal impact
Matching competitor pricing was strategically the right move

projects.title: Digital Strategy — Trunk Tools
projects.subtitle: AI-native Construction Strategy
projects.overview: A strategic analysis of Trunk Tools, an AI-native construction startup building vertical LLM models for field productivity. The project evaluated Trunk’s market fit, competitive landscape, workflow integration, and generated a roadmap for product, GTM, and data moat expansion.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Construction is a $16.4T industry with chronic productivity issues, fragmented workflows, and labor shortages. Teams lose hours searching documentation, reviewing submittals, and coordinating schedules. Traditional construction software is not AI-native and fails to serve field workers effectively.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Docs[Construction Docs: RFIs, Specs, Drawings, Schedules] --> ETL[Document Intelligence Pipeline]
ETL --> VertLLM[Vertical LLM (Construction-trained)]
VertLLM --> Agents[AI Agents: TrunkText / TrunkSubmittal / TrunkSchedule]
Agents --> Mobile[Field Worker Mobile Interface]
Agents --> PM[Project Manager Dashboard]
Mobile --> Feedback[Jobsite Feedback Loop]
PM --> Feedback
Feedback --> Retrain[Model Retraining + Continuous Learning]
challenges: Understanding workflow reality of jobsite teams
Mapping each AI agent to a measurable ROI metric
Evaluating PMF in a highly fragmented industry
Benchmarking Trunk against Procore, Autodesk, OpenSpace
Identifying markets for expansion (Canada, UK, Australia)
learned: How vertical LLMs outperform general-purpose LLMs in industry use cases
How to build a product & market segmentation strategy
How AI can replace documentation work, not workers
How to think like a PM building for safety-critical environments
How to structure a GTM plan for an enterprise AI startup

projects.title: Email Summarizer using n8n
projects.subtitle: Automated weekly digest of top emails with AI
projects.overview: A fully automated email summarizer built using n8n that reads the top 50 emails from a user’s inbox, categorizes key themes, extracts to-do items, and delivers a weekly summary email with highlights and actionable next steps. It connects with Gmail, uses OpenAI for intelligent summarization, and compiles the output into a clean, readable digest sent every Monday.
stack: OpenAI API for summarization and extraction
target_users: Busy professionals drowning in email clutter
Consultants and managers managing multiple clients
Students and researchers seeking weekly knowledge digests
Knowledge workers balancing communication and analysis
impact: Reduces inbox review time by up to 70%
Improves focus by surfacing only what matters

projects.title: FEMA Companion
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
### *Overview* A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) tool that makes **FEMA P-750** and **NIST GCR 2016** seismic design guidelines fully searchable. The system enables engineers to ask natural-language questions and receive precise, citation-backed answers. --- ### **Problem** Seismic codes are dense, technical, and difficult to navigate. Engineers spend significant time manually searching hundreds of pages, often missing important clauses. No existing solution provides fast, authoritative, clause-level lookup grounded directly in source documents. --- ### **Architecture Diagram (High-Level RAG Pipeline)** ```mermaid flowchart LR A[User] --> B[Query Handler] B --> C[Vector Search] C --> D["Document Chunks
(FEMA / NIST)"] D --> E[Embeddings] E --> F[LLM Reasoning] F --> G["Final Answer
+ Citations"] ``` --- ### **Tech Stack** - LangChain - ChromaDB - OpenAI embeddings - GPT models - Python / Streamlit - PDF parsing with `pypdf` --- ### **Key Challenges** - Designing chunk sizes for technical engineering text - Preventing LLM hallucinations with strict grounding constraints - Ensuring consistent citation mapping - Handling mixed-format engineering documents --- ### **What I Learned** - How to build a complete RAG system end-to-end - How retrieval quality affects answer accuracy and trustworthiness - How to design usable AI tools for domain experts - How to enforce accuracy and grounding in engineering workflows ---

projects.title: HR Analytics Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Workforce insights (Tableau + HR metrics)
projects.overview: Designed an interactive Tableau HR Insights Dashboard showcasing employee performance, salary distribution, engagement levels, and attrition patterns. The dashboard enables leaders to explore workforce trends and uncover actionable insights for retention and performance management.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
HR teams and senior leadership often lack a unified view of workforce data. Disconnected systems make it difficult to understand turnover, performance gaps, and compensation fairness. This dashboard consolidates critical HR metrics into a single, intuitive interface.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
A[Employee Dataset] --> B[Data Cleaning in Tableau Prep]
B --> C[Tableau Dashboard Build]
C --> D[Salary Visualization]
C --> E[Performance Scoring]
C --> F[Engagement & Satisfaction Metrics]
F --> G[Insights for HR Strategy]
challenges: Balancing simplicity with detail across multiple HR metrics
Designing comparisons across departments with uneven sample sizes
Showing engagement and satisfaction ratings clearly across diverse ranges
Ensuring HR leaders can quickly drill down into specific employee segments
learned: How to design HR dashboards tailored for executives
How to blend performance, salary, and engagement metrics
How visual comparisons help uncover patterns tied to attrition
How to create an end-to-end Tableau workflow from raw data to dashboard story

projects.title: JobSafetyAI
projects.subtitle: Construction Safety AI in Under 1 Hour
projects.overview:
Built a Construction Safety AI in Under 1 Hour — Thanks to Antigravity.
**The App**
projects.upload_a_construction_site_photo_and_ins:
🟢 Hardhat / 🔴 No Hardhat
🟢 Safety Vest / 🔴 No Safety Vest
😷 Masks, 🚧 Machinery, 🔶 Cones & more
All detected with bounding boxes, confidence scores, and compliance summaries.
projects.i_wanted_to_build_an_end-to-end_construc:
📂 Uses a Kaggle dataset of construction site images
🧠 Trains a custom YOLOv8 object detection model
🦺 Detects PPE compliance (hardhats, vests, masks, etc.)
🌐 Runs in a real-time Streamlit web app

projects.title: Life Expectancy Regression Analysis
projects.subtitle: Statistical modeling of health outcomes (Regression + Minitab)
projects.overview: Conducted a full statistical analysis to understand how BMI and years of schooling influence global life expectancy using WHO and Kaggle data. Applied scatterplots, descriptive statistics, normality tests, simple regression, multiple regression, and model selection criteria (AICC & Adjusted R²).
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Countries struggle to identify which socio-economic factors most strongly impact population health. Life expectancy varies widely across nations, and policymakers need clear, quantitative guidance on which levers—education, lifestyle, or healthcare—drive outcomes.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
A[WHO Life Expectancy Dataset] --> B[Scatterplots & Outlier Detection]
B --> C[Normality Tests & Transformations]
C --> D[Simple Regression Models]
C --> E[Multiple Regression Model]
E --> F[Model Comparison (AICC, Adj R²)]
F --> G[Insights for Policy & Intervention]
challenges: Response variable (Life Expectancy) not normally distributed
Non-constant variance in residual plots
BMI had weak explanatory power compared to schooling
Outliers (e.g., Sierra Leone) skewing model behavior
Choosing the best model when predictors were correlated
learned: Schooling is a far stronger predictor of life expectancy than BMI
Multiple regression improves explanatory power significantly
Outlier and normality checks are critical for reliable inference
Model selection requires balancing statistics with theory
Socio-economic enablers (education, health spending) matter more than BMI alone

projects.title: Mobile App Rank Drivers
projects.subtitle: Demand Modeling & Price Elasticity (STATA)
projects.overview: Built statistical models to identify key drivers of mobile app rank across Apple and Google stores. Used Negative Binomial Regression and log-log models to estimate how price, ratings, file size, screenshots, and monetization features impact app demand.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
App developers struggle to understand which app attributes actually influence store ranking and downloads. With thousands of competing apps, identifying which levers move rank is critical for optimizing visibility and revenue.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Raw App Data → Variable Engineering → STATA Regression Models
→ Elasticity Estimation → Insights for App Store Optimization (ASO)
stack: Market segmentation (Apple vs Google, US vs China, Tablet vs Smartphone)
challenges: Overdispersed count data requiring NBREG instead of Poisson
Significant cross-market elasticity differences (US vs China)
Interpreting log-log coefficients as elasticities
Complex interaction effects (device type × monetization model)
learned: How pricing affects Google users negatively but improves downloads for Apple users
How file size signals “quality” to Apple users, improving rank
How rating count is the strongest universal predictor of app success
How in-app purchases strongly improve rank on smartphones but not tablets

projects.title: Morningstar — Climate Index Construction
projects.subtitle: ESG & Regulatory Analysis
projects.overview: Led the Market & Regulatory Analysis for a climate-aligned European equity index. The project integrated Morningstar + Sustainalytics ESG datasets to create a forward-looking, regulatory-aligned index methodology.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Existing ESG indexes rely on backward-looking emissions and opaque scoring. Investors want transparent, forward-looking climate indexes, aligned to EU Taxonomy, SFDR, and TCFD standards.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Universe[Morningstar Global All-Cap Index] --> Filter1[Exclude Firms Failing Climate Criteria]
Filter1 --> Metrics[Forward-Looking Metrics: Aligned CapEx, Aligned Revenue, SBTi Target, TCFD Disclosure, Management Quality]
Metrics --> Score[Composite Climate Score]
Score --> Weight[Weighted Rebalancing Framework]
Weight --> Index[Morningstar Climate Transition Index]
Index --> QA[Backtesting • Diversification • Risk Checks]
stack: EU Taxonomy, SFDR, CSRD regulatory frameworks
challenges: Missing Scope 3 data
Inconsistent TCFD reporting
Designing methodology that is both investable & climate-aligned
Balancing large-cap dominance vs mid/small cap representation
Avoiding greenwashing
learned: How ESG index construction works behind the scenes
How climate regulations directly shape financial products
How to design transparent scoring methodologies
How forward-looking metrics outperform pure emissions data

projects.title: ParentPal – Custom GPT
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
### *Overview*
ParentPal is an empathetic, safety-aligned AI parenting assistant grounded entirely in HealthyChildren.org (American Academy of Pediatrics). It delivers reliable, age-appropriate guidance for new parents.
---
### **Problem**
Parents are overwhelmed by contradictory online information. They need trusted, source-based advice—and AI models require strict guardrails to avoid unsafe recommendations.---
Architecture Diagram (Custom GPT with Safety Layer)
```mermaid
flowchart LR
User --> GPT[Custom GPT]
GPT --> Rules["System Prompt: Safety + AAP-only Sources"]
Rules --> Healthy[HealthyChildren.org Articles]
Healthy --> GPT
GPT --> User
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- OpenAI Custom GPT builder
- Safety guardrails + structured prompts
- HealthyChildren.org
- Retrieval constraints
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Enforcing strict guardrails for medical-adjacent topics
- Designing empathetic yet factual responses
- Ensuring citations map to approved AAP content
- Maintaining consistency across age groups
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI for safety-critical domains
- How to structure system prompts with constraints
- How to build trust through transparency
- How empathy shapes UX in family-oriented tools
projects.the_mvp_is_structured_around_three_pilla:
Evidence-Based Guidance – Only cites AAP-verified medical sources.
Empathy & Clarity – Friendly tone and simple explanations.
Accessibility & Trust – Fast answers, reliable links, and bilingual support.
projects.user_personas:
👩‍🍼 First-time parents seeking reassurance
👨‍👩‍👧 Families looking for development-stage tips
👩‍⚕️ Childcare workers or educators referencing AAP guidance
Includes built-in trust markers (“Always check with your pediatrician”) and compliance filters to maintain medical reliability and ethical accuracy.

projects.title: Philippines Macroeconomic Analysis
projects.subtitle: Growth drivers & economic resilience (Macro + FRED data)
projects.overview: Performed a comprehensive macroeconomic analysis of the Philippines using 30 years of data from FRED, World Bank, ADB, and trade datasets. Evaluated GDP growth, inflation, exports, productivity, sector composition, labor dynamics, and long-run economic prospects.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Emerging markets like the Philippines show rapid yet volatile growth. Investors, governments, and retirement funds need structured, data-driven insights to assess stability, long-term prospects, and key macro risks.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
A[FRED + World Bank Data] --> B[GDP & Inflation Trends]
A --> C[Trade & Sector Analysis]
A --> D[Labor & Population Metrics]
D --> E[Growth Accounting]
E --> F[Risk Assessment & Investment Outlook]
stack: Trade & industry data (Atlas of Economic Complexity)
challenges: Large multi-source datasets with differing time ranges
Distinguishing structural vs. cyclical drivers of growth
Interpreting conflicting signals (falling fertility vs. rising GDP)
Connecting population trends to productivity forecasts
Assessing geopolitical exposure (U.S.–China dynamics)
learned: The Philippines’ strongest driver of growth is TFP + labor force expansion
Remittances (8% of GDP) act as a stabilizing force during downturns
A booming BPO sector makes the country a “tiger economy”
Aging population and low capital investment pose long-term risks
The country’s 20-year growth outlook is strong, with high investor potential

projects.title: SalesSense AI
projects.subtitle: Real-time sales intelligence agent (RAG + automation)
projects.overview: An AI-powered Sales Intelligence Agent that transforms raw sales data and reports into conversational insights. An n8n automation monitors a Drive/CRM export folder for new files, ingests and embeds them into a vector database, and enables users to ask questions like “How close are we to this month’s goal?”. Produces cited, KPI-grounded responses and scheduled “Sales Snapshot” emails.
stack: n8n automation layer for file change detection
Data normalization for CSVs, Sheets, PDFs
GPT query engine with cited, KPI-focused answers
focus: Visibility: Access key sales insights instantly
Traceability: Every answer cites source data
target_users: Sales and business managers tracking monthly goals
Strategy teams aligning OKRs with metrics
impact: Reduces manual report compilation time by ~80%
Delivers live insights grounded in company data

projects.title: ScentScout — Perfume Aggregator
projects.subtitle: Smart Fragrance Marketplace Strategy
projects.overview:
A data-driven business plan for **ScentScout**, a platform designed to help fragrance enthusiasts find the best deals on luxury perfumes by aggregating listings from high-volume sellers.
**The Solution**
A curated marketplace that vets sellers, tracks price drops, and guarantees authenticity.
- **Vets Sellers**: Only lists items from verified hubs (Dallas, NJ).
- **Price Tracking**: Alerts for "Price Mistakes" on top brands.
- **Revenue Model**: Affiliate commissions + Premium subscriptions ($5/mo).
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
- **High Retail Markups**: Luxury perfumes have massive markups in retail.
- **Fragmented Grey Market**: Affordable authentic perfumes exist on eBay, but finding trustworthy sellers is difficult.
- **Opaque Pricing**: Prices vary by 50%+ depending on the seller and location.
impact: Designed a scalable aggregator model with low inventory risk.
Identified key logistics hubs (Dallas, NJ, Brooklyn) for supply partnerships.
Created a 3-phase operational roadmap from MVP to international expansion.

projects.title: Search Engine Ad Ranking Model
projects.subtitle: Paid Search ML-Style Analytics (STATA)
projects.overview: Designed regression models to predict ad rank using key auction variables including CTR, bid price, ad quality, landing page quality, retailer/brand presence, and daily effects. Achieved high explanatory power for CTR (Adj. R² = 0.91) and strong improvements in Ad Rank prediction when incorporating date effects.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Brands waste ad spend because they don’t know which factors actually improve their paid search ranking. Understanding what drives Google Ad Rank helps optimize bidding, creative, and landing page strategy.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Ad Performance Data → Log Transformations → OLS Model (CTR Drivers)
→ OLS Model (Ad Rank) → Date Fixed Effects Model → Optimization Strategy
challenges: Very strong autocorrelation (lagged CTR dominates predictions)
Low R² for initial Ad Rank model due to missing time-based factors
Non-significant variables (ad quality, landing quality) despite theoretical importance
Identifying daily search competition effects using fixed-effects modeling
learned: CTR is primarily driven by past CTR (reinforcement effect)
Bid price, CTR, brand presence, and retailer names are strong Ad Rank drivers
Daily variations significantly change Ad Rank, improving model accuracy by +7.5%
How to translate statistical modeling into actionable paid search recommendations

projects.title: Submittal AI
projects.subtitle: AI-powered submittal reviewer (Gemini Pro 3)
projects.overview:
Today I built SubmittalCheck AI, an AI-powered submittal reviewer that reads PDFs, checks completeness, flags spec deviations, and drafts engineer-ready comments — all using Google AI Studio + the brand-new Gemini Pro 3.
**The Solution**
projects.my_ai_reviewer_handles_the_tedious_parts:
✔️ Upload PDF: Reads text, tables, scanned pages, cut sheets
✔️ Analyze: Extracts submittal number, spec section, product, model; Checks for missing certificates/calcs; Performs spec compliance + deviation checks
✔️ Draft Response: Generates a clean engineer comment + recommended status (Approved / Approved as Noted / Revise & Resubmit / Rejected)
All automatically logged into Google Docs + Sheets.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Submittal reviews are slow, manual, and error-prone.
Engineers spend hours scanning specs, drawings, cut sheets, and certifications — and it’s easy to miss missing attachments or conflicting details.
Most AEC teams don’t have a lightweight tool that can automate extraction, completeness checks, compliance review, and drafting comments.

projects.title: Tao Climate — Carbon Removal Pricing
projects.subtitle: Market Entry & Pricing Strategy
projects.overview: Developed a pricing and market-entry strategy for hemp-based carbon credits offered by Tao Climate — a climate-tech startup in the XPRIZE Top 100 for carbon removal.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Airlines must decarbonize but face cost pressure and uncertainty around voluntary carbon markets (VCMs). Tao Climate needed to price hemp-based credits competitively while differentiating from DAC, enhanced weathering, BECCS, and biochar.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Market[Global Carbon Market Data] --> Compare[Competitor Benchmarking]
Airlines[Airline Sustainability Requirements] --> Compare
Compare --> Model[Pricing + ROI Model]
Model --> Scenarios[Low / Mid / High Price Scenarios]
Scenarios --> Recs[Final Pricing Strategy]
Supply[Hemp Cultivation + Production Costs] --> Model
Demand[Corporate & Airline Buyer's WTP] --> Model
stack: Industry benchmarking (Climeworks, Charm, Puro.earth, Nori, Vesta)
challenges: Highly inconsistent carbon credit quality & verification
VCM price volatility ($15 → $800 depending on methodology)
Mapping airline sustainability maturity models
Identifying WTP for nature-based vs engineered credits
learned: How to build a defensible pricing model for an emerging market
How buyers evaluate carbon credits (durability, MRV, co-benefits)
How to position a niche product in a highly skeptical market
How to design market segmentation for enterprise buyers

projects.title: Telco Customer Churn Prediction
projects.subtitle: ML & Deep Learning Pipeline
projects.overview:
Built an end-to-end pipeline using the Telco Customer Churn dataset. Compared logistic regression, random forest, and neural networks to predict churn and explain drivers.
**Findings**
- Compared classic ML (Logistic Regression, Random Forest) vs Deep Learning (ANN).
- Identified key churn drivers to help target retention campaigns.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Subscription businesses need to identify at-risk customers early, but most rely on manual analysis or non-predictive dashboards. Telecom companies lose millions annually from preventable churn.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Raw[Raw CSV] --> ETL[Python ETL: Cleaning + Encoding + Scaling]
ETL --> Features[Feature Engineering]
Features --> LogReg[Logistic Regression]
Features --> RF[Random Forest]
Features --> ANN[Neural Network]
LogReg --> Eval[Evaluation]
RF --> Eval
ANN --> Eval
Eval --> Insights[Business Recommendations]
challenges: Handling categorical variables (one-hot encoding)
Preventing data leakage during scaling
Balancing interpretability (logistic regression) vs performance (RF/ANN)
Visualizing churn drivers clearly for stakeholders
Class imbalance
ANN risk of overfitting
learned: How to build ML pipelines end-to-end
How to compare classic ML vs neural networks
How feature engineering impacts model outcomes
How to turn model results into business insights
ML vs DL tradeoffs

projects.title: TripAdvisor Reviews Analysis
projects.subtitle: ML Sentiment & Strategy
projects.overview: Analyzed TripAdvisor review data to identify patterns in sentiment, ratings, review length, and traveler type. Developed recommendations for improving engagement & platform design.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
TripAdvisor receives millions of reviews, but inconsistent sentiment and long-tail content make it hard for users to find helpful insights. The company needs ML-backed insights to improve UX and product decisions.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Raw[TripAdvisor Dataset] --> Clean[Data Cleaning: stopwords, duplicates]
Clean --> NLP[Sentiment Analysis + Keyword Extraction]
NLP --> Clusters[Clustering: themes of reviews]
Clean --> Model[Rating Prediction Model]
Model --> Insights[Business Insights + UX Recs]
challenges: Noisy text
Many reviews contain sarcasm or mixed sentiment
Identifying segments (families vs couples vs solo travelers)
learned: How to extract business insights from unstructured text
How ML models behave with subjective sentiment data
How to translate data findings into product recommendations

projects.title: Understand AI
projects.subtitle: Meeting memory assistant (RAG + reasoning AI)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Understand.AI is an AI-powered meeting memory system built for software engineering teams. It provides fast recall of decisions, rationale, action items, and historical context by unifying transcripts, Slack threads, and notes into a single searchable intelligence layer. The system is designed to help engineers spend less time digging through fragmented documentation and more time building.
### **Problem**
Engineering teams lose hours each week trying to remember what was decided and where context lives. Information is scattered across Confluence, Jira, Slack, raw recordings, and personal notes—causing rework, misalignment, and slowed execution. Teams need a trusted, centralized memory with timestamps, decision history, and explanation paths so they can retrieve context instantly.
### **Tech Stack**
- Claude AI (reasoning & summarization)
- ChatGPT (generation, correction, refinement)
- Loavable (AI workflow + orchestration)
- Vector search (semantic retrieval)
- Meeting transcription (audio → text)
- Figma prototypes (UX flows, interaction design)
- Knowledge Graph (entity + decision linking, conceptual)
### **Key Challenges**
- Building trust through timestamps, source snippets, and uncertainty indicators
- Designing an intuitive search experience that returns context quickly without overwhelming the user
- Handling long transcripts while surfacing only the decisions, rationales, blockers, and action items
- Balancing summary clarity vs. completeness for engineering audiences
- Creating product-led growth loops for cross-team adoption in large orgs (e.g., shareable AI summaries)
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI products specifically for developer workflows and cognitive patterns
- How trust signals (citations, timestamps, transcript excerpts, correction interfaces) dramatically improve adoption
- How to convert raw user pain points into validated UX flows through rapid prototyping
- How PLG motions differ between engineering tools and consumer AI products
- How to shape an AI product around reliability, transparency, and low-friction recall

projects.title: Verra — Sustainable Luxury Brand
projects.subtitle: AI-Driven Brand Development
projects.overview:
Developed a complete luxury perfume brand from concept to market-ready pitch using generative AI and data analytics. The project combined strategic market analysis with AI-powered creativity to create a full brand ecosystem.
**The Brand: Verra**
*Tagline*: Grounded in Truth
*Positioning*: Sustainable Minimalist Luxury for Modern Conscious Youth
*Product*: Verra 01: Rooted — A woody citrus Eau de Parfum ($145)
**Process**
1. **Identity**: Used ChatGPT to generate names and taglines, selecting "Verra" (Truth + Earth).
2. **Visuals**: Created a minimalist, embossed logo and packaging concepts using Leonardo.ai.
3. **Data**: Analyzed 2,000 eBay listings to identify the "Affordable Luxury" gap ($43-$54 avg).
4. **Product**: Designed the scent profile (Bergamot, Vetiver, Cedarwood) and zero-waste packaging (Mushroom mycelium).
5. **Campaign**: Developed the "#MyScentTruth" marketing campaign and pop-up launch strategy.
projects.problem:
**The Problem**
Traditional luxury fragrance brands lack transparency, while clean beauty brands often sacrifice luxury aesthetics. There was no brand serving the "Byredo for the Eco-Conscious" niche—offering premium design, emotional storytelling, and radical sustainability.
projects.architecture:
flowchart LR
Concept[AI Concept Generation] --> Identity[Brand Identity: Verra]
Identity --> Data[Market Analysis: Kaggle Dataset]
Data --> Product[Product Dev: Verra 01 Rooted]
Product --> Campaign[Marketing: #MyScentTruth]
Campaign --> Pitch[Investor Pitch: $500k Seed]
challenges: Balancing luxury aesthetics with zero-waste materials
Differentiating from established "clean" brands like Henry Rose
Justifying the $145 price point with data-driven insights
learned: How to use AI as a creative partner for brand building
The importance of data in validating creative decisions
How to structure a comprehensive business pitch for a CPG product

resume.summary: Engineer-turned-strategist with 7+ years of experience designing complex infrastructure systems and building AI-enabled products. Combines structural engineering rigor with business analytics, product thinking, and hands-on AI development. Currently completing an MBA at NYU Stern, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management.
skills: Business & Strategy (MBA Coursework): Strategy, Operations Management, Tech Product Management, Digital Strategy, Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting, Marketing, Leadership, Negotiation, Decision Models

AI & Product Management: AI/LLM Systems, RAG, Custom GPTs, AI Agents, Prompt Engineering, Product Discovery, User Research, Product Roadmapping, MVP Scoping, Competitive Analysis, KPI Design, LangChain, Streamlit, n8n Automation, ChromaDB, Pinecone
Data & Analytics: SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Python, R Studio, Excel, MATLAB, C++, Statistics, Data Visualization, Digital Marketing Analytics, AI Applications in Business
Structural Engineering & Technical: STAAD Pro, RAM, ETABS, ANSYS, RISA-3D, AutoCAD, Revit, MicroStation, BIM, ENERCALC, SAP2000, MathCAD, ACI/AISC/ASCE Standards, QA/QC
experience: Structural Engineer — Carollo Engineers | Designed & managed multimillion-dollar water infrastructure projects; led cross-discipline coordination, construction support, and QA workflows; built dashboards and analytics tools used by design leadership; improved design review cycle time through data-driven process improvements.

Graduate Projects | NYU Stern School of Business; **Understand.AI — AI Meeting Memory Product* ; - Designed LLM-powered meeting intelligence system; - Conducted user research & validation with engineering teams; - Built UX flows, trust features, and product strategy; **Tao Climate — Carbon Removal Pricing Strategy* ; - Developed pricing strategy for hemp-based carbon credits; - Modeled airline willingness-to-pay & competitive positioning; - Presented recommendations at Google NY; **Morningstar — Climate Index Strategy* ; - Built index methodology using Sustainalytics ESG data; - Modeled climate-aligned weighting scheme
education: MBA — Business Analytics, Strategy, Tech Product Management | NYU Stern School of Business (2023–2026)
MS — Structural/Environmental Engineering | Arizona State University

contact.title: Let's Connect
contact.body:
I'm always excited to connect with people working on innovative products, AI applications, and big strategic challenges.
I also enjoy supporting others on similar journeys. I regularly mentor students interested in engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or navigating early-career decisions. I love helping early-stage startups brainstorm ideas, and I support mission-driven teams and NGOs whenever possible.
If you’d like to chat, explore mentorship, or simply brainstorm, I’d be happy to connect — I’m usually available on weekends.
Looking forward to what's ahead — and grateful that our paths have crossed.
